item.title: Deploying a Flask app on a Heroku free dyno
item.description: tl;dr: Use waitress instead of gunicorn diff --git a/Procfile b/Procfile index d49e1a0..0cd38da 100644 --- a/Procfile +++ b/Procfile @@ -1 +1 @@ -web: gunicorn "app:create_app()" +web: waitress-serve --port=$PORT --threads=${WEB_CONCURRENCY:-2} --call 'app:create_app' Recently, I had trouble deploying a Flask application using gunicorn as the WSGI server on a Heroku’s free dyno tier.
